pages.text: The creation and management of spells is a complicated system to understand, and divided into multiple chapters.$(li)$(l:spells/introduction)The first introduction basic concepts, including imbuing.$()$(li)$(l:spells/introduction2)The second introduction covers the mechanics of imposing modifiers$()$(li)$(l:spells/modifiers)The functional uses of modifiers and spells$()$(li)This entry covers the mechanics of the spell library and its uses$().

As a concept, the library is your combined knowledge of spells and modifiers.$(br2)The interface for interacting with this knowledge is also known as the spell library.$(br2)You add to your knowledge by $(l:spells/introduction#imbuing)imbuing$() spell dust into a $(l:crafting/gramary)gramary$(), or by opening someone else's staff into the library interface.$(br2)You can add modifier knowledge by $(l:spells/introduction2)imposing modifiers$() onto specific spells.

pages.title: Interface
pages.text: The interface is accessed using a $(l:crafting/staff)staff$(). Simply hold the staff in your hand and then press the associated keybind ($(k:roots.keybinds.spell_library)) for opening the library.$(br2)The interface is divided into two sections: the left side is your current staff, while the right side contains every spell you know.$(br2)$(info) Opening a staff containing spells you don't know will add those spells to your library.

pages.title: Spell Library
pages.text: Hovering over a spell will also show you which modifiers have been $(l:spells/introduction2)imposed$().

pages.title: Spell Library Usage
pages.text: The primary use of the spell library interface is to select which spells you want in your staff.$(br2)Clicking a spell in the library and then a staff slot will place that spell there. Likewise, you can swap spells within a staff in the same fashion.$(br2)$(warning) Newly added spells will have modifiers applied but disabled by default.$(br2)

pages.title: Staff Interface
pages.text: $(bold)Alt-Click$() to access modifiers for this specific staff. $(l:spells/introduction2)See modifiers$().
